speaker: Skyline
text: Red, yellow, and blue balloons fly over the city.  _ACT ONE  Scene One - Frasier's apartment Roz, Martin, and Frasier are gathered around the dining table._

speaker: Roz
text: So what's the plan?  Are we going to turn off the lights and jump out and yell "surprise!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, Roz, let's startle a man who just had open-heart surgery.

speaker: Roz
text: Sorry, I can't get used to thinking of Niles as "sick."

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Niles is great.  All these exercises he's doing, he's going to be just as strong as he ever was.

speaker: Daphne
text: Here's the guest of honor.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, good to see you out and about!

speaker: Roz
text: You look great!

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you!  Thank you, I tell you it's good to be out after being cooped up in that apartment all week.  Hello. [_He pets Eddie._]  I never thought I'd grow tired of reading Flaubert.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh please, he's been parked on his ass watching _The Young and the Restless_.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  Not the soaps!  You can't be serious.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm hardly hooked.  They fascinate me as-as cultural

speaker: Gertrude
text: their use of stock figures is reminiscent of the _commedia dell'arte_. Yes, uh, Esther is Punchinello, Victor is Flavio, and Nikki -- well, she's just the town pump.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Now do you see why I need my own telly, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_bitingly_] You have your own telly in Manchester.

speaker: Frasier
text: Here's champagne and sparkling cider for you, Niles. and help yourself to brunch whenever you're ready.

speaker: Martin
text: Word to the wise: stay away from the sausage.

speaker: Frasier
text: They're not sausages, Dad, they're "soysages."  Niles is on a postoperative diet.  We are trying to support him.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sorry.  What about the bacon?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_grinning_] "Fake-un."

speaker: Niles
text: Okay, everyone, I'd like to propose a toast. [_they all rise_] To my family and friends, your love and support have been overwhelming.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: You know, during my operation, I was technically dead for several minutes.

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, we know son, you told us.

speaker: Niles
text: But, it gave me a fresh perspective on everything.  It took a brush with death to remind me how lucky I am to be alive.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well done.

speaker: Niles
text: And Gertrude, thank you for giving up the guest bedroom so that I don't have to climb all those stairs.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, no, I'm happy to sleep on that sofa bed with its hard metal frame.

speaker: Daphne
text: You have a _nice_ soft bed in Manchester.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Daphne, it's okay.  Her bracing honesty reminds me that I'm alive.  You... you... oh, you! [_He tightly embraces Gertrude._] You are a treasure to me.  I cherish every day we're together.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, thank you, Niles!  There may be others around here who could benefit from a near-death experience.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, let's eat before the fake-un loses its shape.

speaker: Roz
text: Wow!  Niles is really loving life with a vengeance.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I was the same way after I got shot.  My first day back at the precinct I went around hugging all the guys telling them all I loved them.

speaker: Roz
text: How long did that last?

speaker: Martin
text: Until they started calling me "Martina."

speaker: Roz
text: It is kind of weird seeing Niles all lovey-dovey with Mrs. Moon.

speaker: Martin
text: Believe me, when you're in that state, you can find something to love even in the biggest jerk.

speaker: Niles
text: [_from the table_] Roz, I want to tell you, you are a treasure. Maybe I don't say it often enough, but you are.

speaker: Roz
text: [_as Martin opens his mouth_] Shut up, Martina!  _FADE OUT  Scene Two -- Cafe Nervosa Roz is seated.  Frasier enters carrying a CD and humming a familiar Mozart theme.  He sits next to Roz._

speaker: Roz
text: Hi.  I know that song.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Mozart _Symphony No. 40: Molto Allegro_.  I just bought this new recording for Niles.  It is fantastic.  I've never heard such string articulation.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I remember what it is!  It's that commercial with the singing cats. [_singing to the Mozart theme_] "If your cat has a yearning for tuna, Da-da-da, Da-da Ocean Buffet, Da-da- da..."  One of the cats was wearing a tiny tuxedo.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good!  So few cats dress for the symphony anymore.

speaker: Daphne
text: Frasier, Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi guys!

speaker: Daphne
text: Guess who just walked a mile on the treadmill?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh way to go, Niles!

speaker: Daphne
text: The doctor says he's in the 95th percentile of patients recovering from bypass surgery.

speaker: Frasier
text: 95th percentile!  That's wonderful, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, now Frasier, good health is not a competition!  When you've heard time's winged chariot hurrying here, as I have, every day is a gift. [_noticing Frasier's CD_]  Oh, yoiks, what tone-deaf prankster gave you this?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_taken aback, but controlled_] You've...heard it?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, as much as I could bear.  Did you hear what the conductor did to the Andante?  I just hope he bought it dinner first.

speaker: Frasier
text: I couldn't agree more, Niles.

speaker: Roz
text: [_shocked_] Frasier, you said you loved that CD.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Niles has convinced my otherwise.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, I'm in the mood for a scone.  Help me pick one out.

speaker: Niles
text: All right. [_they walk to the counter_]

speaker: Roz
text: That was weird.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll say.  Who can't pick out their own scone?

speaker: Roz
text: No.  I mean you and Niles.  Usually that would have been a two-hour argument ending in tears and cursing in Italian.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm afraid those days are over, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: What happened?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's a long story.  Okay.  When Niles was in the hospital and he was being wheeled into surgery [_he shakes his head with foreboding_] he looked so frail and vulnerable, so I... I took my case to a higher power. _DISSOLVE TO: The scene fades to the hospital as Niles is being wheeled away. Frasier is shown alone in the room, thinking.  We hear his prayer._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o._] Hello, God.  It's me, Dr. Frasier Crane.  Though I don't talk to you as often as I should, I want to thank you for all the times you've indulged me in the past - although I have yet to see the inside of the Empire Club.  Just kidding.  Anyway, today I ask you to look after my brother Niles Crane.  I love him, even if I don't always show it, and I regret all the time he and I have wasted in petty quarrels.  If you spare him, Oh Lord, I promise to cherish every moment we have together.

speaker: Roz
text: But Frasier, you don't think God is going to strike Niles down if you get in an argument, do you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, technically, the way it's structured, he'd come after me, seeing as I was the one who initiated the deal, you see.  If I'd had more time, I might have worded things differently, but...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, oh, uh, let's get this to go.  My soap starts in twenty minutes.  Ashley might come out of her coma today.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, since your recovery's going so well, maybe we should check you out, make sure all your equipment's working properly.

speaker: Niles
text: You're not talking about my exercise bicycle, are you?

speaker: Daphne
text: Mmm-mmm.  The doctor said it would be OK.  If you need a second opinion, maybe Nurse Naughty could make a house call.

speaker: Niles
text: I could use a checkup... but I think we should err on the Side of caution.  In a few weeks, I have another stress test. [_to the waiter_] Thank you.  And if all goes well, Nurse Naughty will be one satisfied health care professional.

speaker: Niles
text: See you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Bye.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bye guys.

speaker: Roz
text: Bye.  Oh, Niles, wait.  Frasier says the string articulation is really good.

speaker: Niles
text: In this?  Frasier, you know I hold your opinion in highest regard, but are you nuts?

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps I am, Niles, thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Maybe you just need to get your hearing checked.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll do that.  Thank you, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_loudly_] I'll see you later!

speaker: Frasier
text: Very amusing!  I get it.  Ha ha.   **WEEKS LATER (AND ASHLEY'S STILL IN A COMA)**  _Scene Three - Frasier's apartment Niles and Frasier enter._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, oh, here they are.  Frasier, tell them what you told me.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_glaring at Niles and forcing a smile_] Freud is the poor man's Jung.

speaker: Niles
text: I never thought I'd live to see the day.  Perhaps this is why I was spared.

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, how was your stress test?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, uh, the doctor cleared me for normal food and-and regular physical activity.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_embracing him excitedly_] Oh, Darling, that's wonderful!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, you know, in moderation, of course.

speaker: Martin
text: Congratulations, son.

speaker: Niles
text: Thanks.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, perhaps now, Niles, we can get back to the squash courts.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I don't think so.

speaker: Frasier
text: But the doctor said it was OK.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but shouldn't there be more to life than competition for useless bragging rights?

speaker: Frasier
text: You didn't think they were useless three months ago when you won.  You bragged for three months.

speaker: Niles
text: I've changed a lot since then.  The point is that I have roses to stop and smell.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see, so let me get this straight. You're going to give up squash and smell roses.

speaker: Niles
text: Poor Frasier.  I hope that you don't have to go through what I did in order to become as wise as I have.

speaker: Daphne
text: You can still be wise _and_ play squash, darling.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, Daphne's right.  Go out and have some fun.

speaker: Niles
text: But I am having fun!  Since my incident, birds sing more sweetly.  The sky is so much bluer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, it has rained every day this week.

speaker: Niles
text: I see rain differently too.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, there's something I need to tell you.  It's something I've been thinking about...  _At this point there is a loud thunderclap and lightning flash, which Frasier clearly interprets as a divine warning._

speaker: Niles
text: You were saying, Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Nothing.  _FADE OUT  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Four - KACL Frasier is taking a call._

speaker: Grant
text: [_v.o._] Hey, Dr. Crane.  Well, my grandmother died a couple of weeks ago and I feel bad because I never told her how much she meant to me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, my heart certainly goes out to you.  Grieving is Difficult enough without those unresolved...

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, I'm sorry to interrupt, but we have Dr. Niles Crane on line two.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pausing_] I'm sure you all remember my brother Niles from our last segment. [_He forces a grin._] I'm sure all my listeners join me in hoping he can get back to work _real_ soon.

speaker: Niles
text: [_v.o._] Thank you, Frasier.  I just thought I'd add the Perspective of one who has ducked the scythe of the Grim Reaper.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_controlling himself_] By all means, go ahead, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_v.o._] Grant, your grandmother knows how you feel.  When I was briefly dead, the overriding feeling I had was the love of my family and friends.  _Frasier has moved to the corner, where an inflatable clown stands. He begins to forcefully punch the clown._

speaker: Grant
text: Wow!  So I shouldn't feel bad?

speaker: Niles
text: Certainly not.  Get out there and live your life, Grant. Carpe that diem. [_Frasier has returned and replaced his headphones._] Isn't that right, Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: I couldn't agree more, Niles.  We'll be right back after traffic.  _Frasier cuts off the talk line and rises.  He gives a couple more punishing blows to the inflated clown._

speaker: Roz
text: I'm beginning to regret betting on the clown.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I can't eat.  I can't sleep.  I just lie awake in bed at night mentally arguing with Niles. [_He throws the clown back in its corner._] And I win every time!

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, this is insane.  Do you really think something bad is going to happen if you break your deal with God?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, of course not.  Well, maybe a little.  I don't know. Roz, my brother could have died.  I can't be ungrateful to whatever higher power may have spared him.

speaker: Roz
text: I just can't imagine that God would be upset...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, he's God, Roz!  Have you read the Old Testament?  He can be ruthless!

speaker: Roz
text: Traffic's done.  You're on in five. [_She rushes back to her booth._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_replacing his headphones_] Welcome back, Seattle.  Oh, I see we have someone on line two.  Go ahead, caller, I'm listening.

speaker: Niles
text: [_v.o._] Still me, Frasier.  Say, I had some thoughts about your advice to Cynthia from Tacoma...

speaker: Niles
text: Speaking as one who has walked through the valley of the shadow of death, Cynthia, I think diets and exercise should take care of your problem.  Nothing like a good fat-free muffin to send you on your way... _In the course of the above, Frasier wrestles the clown to the ground and pummels it mercilessly.  He reaches up and grabs the phone receiver, using it to administer even more blows to the unfortunate inflatable toy.  FADE TO:  Scene Five - Niles and Daphne's apartment Frasier has knocked at the door.  Daphne answers._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Daph, I'm here for Niles.

speaker: Daphne
text: He's at your place.  He said you were meeting him there for dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I specifically told him I would pick him up here. Ah...

speaker: Daphne
text: Sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's not bad enough he usurps my radio show... What are you doing?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, you'll think I'm silly, but I'm donating food to the poor.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why would I think that's silly?  What does that say about me?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, I was just going to say...

speaker: Frasier
text: I do my bit for charity, you know.  You have no idea how many vacations I've bought at silent auctions.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, that's not it.  You see, when I found out Niles needed heart surgery I felt so scared and helpless, so I kind of made a vow that if he came out okay I would spend more time helping the less fortunate.

speaker: Frasier
text: A vow?  You mean, like a promise to God?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, I know, it must sound absurd to you, a man of science.

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  No, now when exactly did you make this promise?

speaker: Daphne
text: The night before his surgery.

speaker: Frasier
text: The night before, you say. [_He ponders._] Interesting.  You say Niles is at my place?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me.  Keep up the good work.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, what's all this?

speaker: Daphne
text: Food for the poor.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, it must be nice to be poor and have people just giving you food.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Daphne, you were up awfully late last night.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, I was watching television.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Were you?  Or was that husband of yours sneaking upstairs to demand you perform your wifely chore?

speaker: Daphne
text: I wish.  He's still not ready to be in the same bed with me.

speaker: Gertrude
text: He's rich, and you don't have to sleep with him.  Rub it in, why don't you?

speaker: Daphne
text: I know he's trying to ease back into things, but it's been weeks since the doctor said he was okay.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Well, isn't it obvious?  The poor thing's probably not feeling very attractive.  I mean, he's all skinny and pale, and now he has that scar, too.

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't think that's it, Mum.  I just think he's scared and I understand that.  But how long are we going to go on like this?

speaker: Gertrude
text: Until you stop babying him.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm not babying him.  I'm just giving him the time he needs.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, piffle.  What he needs is a swift kick in the bum.  Look, you've got to seduce him.  Use your feminine wiles.  That's how your brother Billy landed Kevin.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_nodding_] Well, sharing a cell helped.  You know, maybe I'll give that a try.  When Niles walks into that guest room tonight, I'll have a surprise waiting for him -- candles, soft music, a negligee... nothing too sexy, we don't want to strain his heart.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Well, there's nothing wrong with your ego.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thanks for the advice, Mum.

speaker: Gertrude
text: My pleasure, love.  And since you and Niles will be in the guest room, I'll sleep in your room tonight.  No sense in letting that king-sized bed go to waste.

speaker: Daphne
text: This time, use a coaster when you take your teeth out. _Gertrude heads upstairs.  FADE TO:  Scene Six - Frasier's apartment Niles and Martin are watching the soap on tape._

speaker: Martin
text: Stop the tape.  Who's he again?

speaker: Niles
text: That's Diego, the illegitimate son of Sonia LaFontaine. He joined the army to avenge the death of his brother, although I'm a little worried about him.  I'm not sure he's fighting this war for the right reasons.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, you want some of this fancy dessert?  It must be really good because Frasier told me not to touch it.

speaker: Niles
text: No.  No thanks, I brought some of these tasty rye flats in case I feel peckish.  [_N.B. Niles pulls the "rye flats" in a ziploc bag out of what is clearly a fanny pack.  This must be one of the ones he won in the first episode of the arc, "Bristle While You Work"[[10.07]](/frasier/transcripts/season_10/episode_7/bristle_while_you_work_1.html "Bristle While You Work \[1\]"), since he had no idea what a "fanny pack" was before this point._]

speaker: Martin
text: They look like wood!  I thought your doctor cleared you to eat normal foods.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, uh, he did, but I feel my tastes have gotten simpler since I cheated death. _He takes a bite of the rye wafer and contorts his face as he struggles to force it down._

speaker: Niles
text: It's hard to explain.

speaker: Martin
text: Don't need to explain to me, son.  I know what it's like to cheat death.

speaker: Niles
text: That's true, although I think I got a little closer than you did.

speaker: Martin
text: [_offended_] Oh, really?  Well, let's see.  I got shot by a gun, and you ate a bunch of cheese.

speaker: Niles
text: I was clinically dead for several minutes.  I looked Death square in the eye.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you might have looked him in the eye, but I shook his hand.

speaker: Niles
text: Really.  Well I kissed him on the cheek.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I kissed him on the lips.  Also, Death was a girl.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, I don't want to turn this into a competition.  I'm just trying to embrace life to the fullest.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, will you give it a rest!

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Martin
text: You haven't embraced a damn thing.  All you're doing is yakking about feeling this and experiencing that.  You're not doing anything.  You won't go back to work or play squash or eat any of your favorite foods.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm just, I'm easing into things until I'm back to normal.

speaker: Martin
text: The doctor says you're there.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm just being extra cautious.

speaker: Martin
text: Sounds to me like you're afraid, son.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, what if I am?  Haven't I earned the right to be afraid? I could have died.

speaker: Martin
text: I understand.

speaker: Niles
text: Okay.

speaker: Martin
text: When I got out of the hospital, I was terrified to take a risk.  I didn't want to leave the house.  Ducked for cover every time a car backfired.

speaker: Niles
text: [_pausing_] I know my fears aren't rational.  I know my heart is sound.  I feel fine.  But I felt fine before this happened.  How do I know that the same thing isn't going to...

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you don't know!  That's exactly what I came to realize. Life's a crap shoot.  We could all go at any time.  That's why we have to make the most of whatever time we've got. _Niles ponders this.  Martin, to drive his point home, imitates Niles' pompous phraseology._

speaker: Martin
text: Like sand through the hourglass, so are the Days of Our Lives...

speaker: Niles
text: Okay, point taken. _He rises enthusiastically and taps Martin on the shoulder.  He gets his coat and moves to exit._

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you, Dad!

speaker: Martin
text: Where you going?

speaker: Niles
text: To live my life!

speaker: Martin
text: You forgot the rye flats.

speaker: Niles
text: [_with a sense of awakening_] No, I didn't, Dad.  No, I didn't.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you're not leaving them here! _Niles retrieves the rye flats.  FADE TO:  Scene Seven - The elevator of Frasier's building A couple exits and Frasier enters the elevator, after which he is alone._

speaker: Frasier
text: Good evening.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, God, it's me again.  Dr. Frasier Crane.  Listen, it seems that when we made our little arrangement, there was another deal in place.  Now, I've had some experience with double-booking, and I know that the person who books first always gets priority.  So, as long as Daphne keeps her end -- which she is, to the letter - it seems our little arrangement would be rendered null and void.  Ergo, I am now going to yell at my brother. [_He beams._] Unless of course, you give me a sign.

speaker: Frasier
text: Very well, then.  This is going to be sweet. _Frasier laughs with joy.  The elevator dings and opens.  Niles is standing there, and Frasier storms out, primed to explode._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: There you are!  You're forty minutes late.  Well, no matter, I have more important things to do.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not so fast, Mister!  You, sir, have been insufferable for the past few weeks.  It might enlighten you to know that your endless preaching has been nothing more than a thin cover for your fear...

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I know.  I know, I know.  Dad just told me, and he was right.  I've been an ass lately.  I am really sorry, but I have to go.  My wife is waiting for me.

speaker: Niles
text: Frankly, Frasier, I'm surprised you didn't bring this up sooner.

speaker: Frasier
text: But... _The elevator closes with Niles inside and Frasier out.  He looks heavenward, quite bemused._

speaker: Frasier
text: Huh... Well played, God. [_He takes out his keys._] I'll see you at Easter. _He enters his apartment.  FADE TO:  Scene Eight - Niles and Daphne's apartment. It is dark.  Niles runs inside, rapidly shedding his clothing as he rushes upstairs.  A pause.  There is a piercing high-pitched scream.  Daphne comes out of the guest room wearing a sexy nurse costume, complete with garters and stockings.  Niles runs downstairs, his shirt untucked and his tie still on._

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles!  What happened?

speaker: Daphne
text: Are you all right?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  I just jumped into bed with your mother.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, dear.  No wonder she screamed.

speaker: Niles
text: That wasn't her.

speaker: Daphne
text: What were you doing in there?

speaker: Niles
text: I just... wanted to... take my wife into my arms and show her how much I love her.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_excited_] Are you sure you're ready?

speaker: Niles
text: Trust me.  If my heart can take _that_ , it can take anything. _In a burst of energy, Niles lifts Daphne with the intention of carrying her off.  After a few steps it becomes too much and he gives up the effort, setting her down.  They walk off holding hands.  FADE OUT  END OF ACT TWO_
